posts.message:
Geeks,

Out of mere curiosity, I'd like to know your thoughts on the Apple iOS backdoor story. 

I personally think it's purely a trust building feat more than anything else. Especially because most of the companies that backed Apple in the backdoor issue, are involved in PRISM: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PRISM_(surveillance_program) - Microsoft, Fb, and Google were among the first to back Apple's position against the FBI, and they're all in there, including Apple of course.

I understand that a backdoor would be a whole other level of wtf, but I would still not be very trusting of them from a privacy POV, if at all.

Thoughts?

posts.message:
During my quest to make better use of my time, i started listening to podcasts a couple of months ago and that really helped me save time and make use of otherwise wasted time, so i wrote a blog post about some of my favorite podcasts.

In the blog post i wrote short description about each podcast along with average duration of episodes, podcast website, and direct RSS feed URL to add to your podcast app.

=========================
The tl;dr version:
PHP-related Podcasts
- /dev/hell
- PHP Town Hall
Laravel-related Podcasts
- Laravel News
- The Laravel Podcast
Linux-related Podcasts
- LINUX Unplugged
- The Linux Action Show
=========================

This is the first part, i'll write another post about podcasts concerned with security and software development in general.
